skill.name: accessibility-wcag
skill.description: Enforce WCAG 2.2 accessibility standards. Use when creating UI components, reviewing frontend code, or when accessibility issues are detected. Covers semantic HTML, ARIA, keyboard navigation, and color contrast.
skill.summary: Enforce WCAG 2.2 accessibility standards. Use when creating UI components, reviewing frontend code, ...
skill.author: Doyajin174

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or command execution capabilities. The skill provides WCAG 2.2 accessibility guidelines in Markdown format.

content.value_statement: Many websites fail accessibility standards, excluding users with disabilities. This skill ensures all UI components meet WCAG 2.2 requirements including semantic HTML, ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, and color contrast ratios.
actual_capabilities: Ensures keyboard accessibility and focus management
Verifies color contrast ratios (4.5:1 for AA)
limitations: Cannot test actual screen reader output
Cannot verify accessibility through live browser testing
Cannot measure actual color contrast values automatically
Does not replace manual accessibility testing

use_cases.title: Build accessible components
use_cases.description: Create new React, Vue, or HTML components following WCAG 2.2 guidelines for full accessibility compliance.

use_cases.title: Review code for accessibility
use_cases.description: Identify and fix accessibility issues in pull requests before merging to main branch.

use_cases.title: Audit existing interfaces
use_cases.description: Evaluate current web applications for WCAG 2.2 compliance and document accessibility gaps.

prompt_templates.title: Basic accessibility check
prompt_templates.scenario: Check a component for WCAG compliance
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this React component for WCAG 2.2 accessibility issues. Check for semantic HTML, keyboard accessibility, ARIA attributes, and color contrast. List any violations and provide fixed code.

prompt_templates.title: Form accessibility review
prompt_templates.prompt: Check this form implementation for accessibility compliance. Verify all inputs have proper labels, error messages are announced to screen readers, and focus management works correctly.

prompt_templates.title: Modal dialog audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this modal dialog implementation. Ensure it has proper role='dialog', aria-modal, keyboard trapping, focus management, and escape key support per WCAG 2.2 guidelines.

prompt_templates.title: Color contrast analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the color scheme in this stylesheet. Calculate contrast ratios for all text colors against their backgrounds. Flag any that fail WCAG AA (4.5:1) or AAA (7:1) requirements.

output_examples.input:
Make this button accessible:
Submit
output: Replace <div> with <button> for native keyboard support
Add visible focus style with CSS outline
Remove cursor: pointer from div - button already has it

best_practices: Use semantic HTML elements (<button>, <nav>, <main>) instead of <div> with ARIA
Ensure all interactive elements are keyboard accessible with visible focus indicators
Test with keyboard-only navigation and screen readers before deployment
anti_patterns: Using <div> with onClick instead of <button> elements
Removing outline:focus styles without providing alternative focus indicators
Relying solely on color to convey information without text or icons

faq.question: What WCAG level does this skill enforce?
faq.answer: This skill enforces WCAG 2.2 Level AA requirements as the minimum standard for all components.

faq.question: Does this skill work with all frontend frameworks?
faq.answer: Yes. The accessibility principles apply to React, Vue, Angular, Svelte, and plain HTML/CSS projects.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for mobile app accessibility?
faq.answer: Most guidelines transfer to React Native and Flutter. Native iOS/Android require platform-specific accessibility APIs.

faq.question: Does this skill store any user data?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill with no data storage, network calls, or file system access capabilities.

faq.question: How do I verify accessibility beyond this skill?
faq.answer: Use axe-core, Lighthouse, or WAVE for automated testing. Complete manual testing with keyboard and screen readers.

faq.question: How does this compare to ESLint accessibility plugins?
faq.answer: This skill catches broader design patterns and provides fixes. Use eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y for build-time automated enforcement.
